Discussed presentation anxiety (Comm 101 speech), overwhelming calculus workload, and roommate conflicts. Solutions offered: 1) Potato visualization + timed practice for presentations, 2) Breaking math into song/dance segments, 3) Humorous conflict resolution (sticky notes). Lisa initially resisted ('eye-rolling') but accepted solutions through humor negotiation ('boba bribes'). Progress evidenced by completing multiple presentation practices, solving calculus problems after breakthrough ('enjoying math?!'), using improv to navigate campus politics, and initiating follow-up plans. Defensive sarcasm transformed into collaborative problem-solving.

fears_materialized.Choosing the right career path: Avoiding career fairs/networking due to anxiety

evolution_stages.conversation_summary: 1) Problems discussed: Presentation anxiety (COMM 101 speech), procrastination, and roommate conflict (clothes theft). 2) Solutions offered/accepted: Humorous visualization techniques (potato audience), timed practice with recording, boba reward system, and venting session for roommate stress. 3) Student's response: Initially resistant to traditional advice but engaged with humor-based solutions; shared personal failure story; completed practice run; agreed to future meeting. 4) Evidence of progress: Transitioned from eye-rolling dismissal to active participation in practice; used self-deprecating humor to process anxiety; decreased physiological symptoms (laughter replaced fidgeting); established mentor trust through shared vulnerability.

fears_materialized.Dealing with roommate conflicts: Roommate stealing clothes without permission and gaslighting Lisa about it

Discussed 1) Presentation anxiety for Comm 101 midterm, 2) Calculus avoidance leading to all-nighters, and 3) Roommate conflicts. Solutions offered/accepted: a) Potato visualization for audience anxiety, b) Timed speech practice with recording, c) Math concept humor reframing ('emo numbers'), d) Tutor scheduling with escape strategies. Student responded positively by completing speech practice, solving equations, and scheduling help. Progress evidenced through reduced defensiveness, voluntary skill practice, and transformed anxiety into creative solutions (improv troupe concept).
